title: Production promotion + smoke test documentation for approved Version 25 (no app changes)

requirements.summary: Document the promotion of the already-approved Version 25 preview build to production with no code/content changes, ensuring production runs in release mode without preview artifacts.
acceptanceCriteria: Production deployment is promoted from the exact approved Version 25 build/commit (no additional changes introduced).
Visiting the production URL loads Version 25 as the active main version.
No preview-only URL parameters, version query strings, or debug labels are visible in the production UI (release mode behavior remains intact).

file_operations.description: Create a Version 25-specific production promotion runbook that references the existing frontend/PRODUCTION_PROMOTION.md and records the exact approved Version 25 build/commit identifier, production URL, and explicit confirmation that no code/content changes were introduced during promotion. Include a verification note to confirm release-mode behavior (e.g., preview URL parameters are sanitized and no debug labels appear) without requiring any application code changes.

requirements.summary: Provide a Version 25 production smoke test results log aligned to frontend/PRODUCTION_SMOKE_TEST.md and the specified end-to-end Valentine flow checks.
acceptanceCriteria: Smoke test is completed on at least 2 browsers and 2 device types as suggested by the checklist.

The following core flow passes in production: Welcome screen → Start button starts background music → quiz progression (no advance on wrong answers) → quiz completion → final page → “Open Our Memories” reveal → memories gallery thumbnails render → lightbox opens/closes → love letter text is visible and readable.
Any failures are documented with notes sufficient to reproduce (or the run is marked as fully passing).

file_operations.description: Create a production smoke test results template/log for Version 25 that points testers to execute the checklist in frontend/PRODUCTION_SMOKE_TEST.md and captures: production URL, date/time, tester, browser/device matrix (at least 2 browsers and 2 device types), pass/fail per section, and reproducible notes/screenshots references for any failures. Ensure the log explicitly calls out the required core Valentine flow and records whether it passed end-to-end in production.
